abstract: Slate entered the frigid waters of the iPad application ecosystem on Wednesday with an app that lets readers listen to podcasts, watch videos and share content on social networks.
snippet: Slate entered the frigid waters of the iPad application ecosystem on Wednesday with an app that lets readers listen to podcasts, watch videos and share content on social networks.
lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, Jacob Weisberg, editor in chief of the Slate Group, the Washington Post Company unit that owns Slate.com, wrote an article titled “Apple’s Way: Why publishers should beware the App Store.” Mr. Weisberg offers words of caution to publishers optimistically believing that applications built exclusively for the iPad will offer windfalls of money and in a sense, save the publishing industry.

abstract: A critical mass of tricks and tips for the iPhone 4 have started to pile up. Here’s a look at three cool iOS 4 features that nobody, including Apple, seems to be talking about.
snippet: A critical mass of tricks and tips for the iPhone 4 have started to pile up. Here’s a look at three cool iOS 4 features that nobody, including Apple, seems to be talking about.
lead_paragraph: It seems as though Apple dodged a bullet. Ever since the Steve Jobs press conference a couple of weeks ago, in which Apple offered free carrying casesbumpers (or full refunds) to anyone whose iPhone 4 exhibits the signal-drops-when-you-hold-the-phone-a-certain-way problem, the jeering and mockery online seems to have gone into hibernation.

headline.main: Three Unknown Features of the iPhone 4
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: Some doctors in Massachusetts are handing out coupons for use at farmers’ markets in an effort to promote healthy eating and combat childhood obesity.
snippet: Some doctors in Massachusetts are handing out coupons for use at farmers’ markets in an effort to promote healthy eating and combat childhood obesity.
lead_paragraph: The farm stand is becoming the new apothecary, dispensing apples  not to mention artichokes, asparagus and arugula  to fill a novel kind of prescription.
